name: Seated Dumbbell Side Lateral
how_to_perform:
1. Sit on a flat surface, such as a chair or bench.
2. Hold a dumbbell in your right hand with your palm facing your body.
3. Keeping your upper arm still, lift the dumbbell out to the side until it is at shoulder height, keeping your elbow close to your body.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position without releasing it.
5. Perform the same movement with your left hand.
short_summary: Seated dumbbell side laterals are an isolation exercise that target the lateral muscles of the arms and shoulders, while also engaging the core and improving overall shoulder stability.
